Detailed Description

Base class for all camera objects.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzCamera::CameraType

The different types of camera. Each has its own default parameters which it resets to and are either orthogonal or perspective by definition.

Enumerator:
FRONT_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view the front of a figure

BACK_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view the back of a figure

LEFT_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view the left side of a figure

RIGHT_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view the right side of a figure

TOP_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view a figure from the top

BOTTOM_CAMERA 

Orthogonal camera positioned to view a figure from the bottom

PERSPECTIVE_CAMERA 

Default perspective camera - defaults to a front view of a figure

ORTHO_CAMERA 

General Orthogonal camera

GENERAL_CAMERA 

General Perspective camera

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzCamera::DzCamera ( CameraType  type,
bool  isViewCam = false 
)

Constructor. Sets the camera type. If isViewCam is true, then the camera will be non-animatable.

Parameters:
type The type of the camera
isViewCam If true, the camera is a view camera, if false, the camera is a normal scene camera.
DzCamera::~DzCamera (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

DzCamera::DzCamera ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

void DzCamera::accFrustum ( float  left,
float  right,
float  bottom,
float  top,
float  nearplane,
float  farplane,
float  focus,
bool  antiAlias,
bool  depthOfField,
int  pass,
const QRect &  tile 
) const [protected]

Calculates a frustum for the camera

Parameters:
left The left side of the projection
right The right side of the projection
bottom The bottom of the projection
top The top of the projection
nearplane The distance to the near clipping plane
farplane The distance to the far clipping plane
focus The distance to the focal plane
antiAlias Whether or not this camera should be jittered for antialiasing
depthOfField Whether or not this camera should be jittered for depth of field
pass The current render pass
tile The portion of the final image to project for.

bool  antiAlias,
bool  depthOfField,
int  pass,
const QRect &  view,
const QRect &  tile 
) const [protected]

Calculates a perspective projection for the camera.

Parameters:
fovy The field of view for the camera
aspect The aspect ratio of the camera
nearplane The distance to the near clipping plane
farplane The distance to the far clipping plane
focus The distance to the focal plane
antiAlias Whether or not this camera should be jittered for anti-aliasing
depthOfField Whether or not this camera should be jittered for depth of field
pass The current render pass
view The size of the view
tile The portion of the view to project.
void DzCamera::aimAt ( const DzVec3 &  pos  )  [pure virtual, slot]

Rotates the camera and adjusts its focal distance so that its focal point is at the given point.

Parameters:
pos The point to aim the camera at.

Implemented in DzBasicCamera, DzDistantLight, DzLight, and DzSpotLight.

void DzCamera::frame ( const DzBox3 &  box,
float  aspect 
) [pure virtual, slot]

Translates the camera so that its view frames the given box, and sets the camera's focal point to the center of the box, given the aspect ratio of the current view (w / h)

Parameters:
box The bounding box to frame in the camera's view
aspect The aspect ratio of the current view.

Implemented in DzBasicCamera, DzDistantLight, DzLight, and DzSpotLight.

DzLight * DzCamera::getHeadlight (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
A light that lights the scene in front of the camera. Used for rendering by OpenGL and offline renderers when no lights exist in the scene. This headlight is created on demand - i.e. no headlight for this camera exists until this function is called the first time.

void DzCamera::setFocalDistance ( double  dist  )  [pure virtual]

Set the camera focal distance. This effectively moves the camera focal point without moving the camera itself.

Parameters:
dist The distance to the focal plane

Implemented in DzBasicCamera, DzDistantLight, and DzLight.

Set the camera focal length.

Parameters:
dist The focal length of the camera lens.

Implemented in DzBasicCamera, and DzLight.

void DzCamera::setGL ( int  width,
int  height,
const QRect &  view,
int  pass = 0,
int  totalPasses = 1,
bool  depthOfField = false 
) [pure virtual]

Called by the framework to set the camera up for OpenGL rendering according to the current view type. Needs to have the current window dimensions. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
width The width of the area to be rendered by the camera
height The height of the area to be rendered by the camera
view A rectangle describing the portion of the area rendered by the camera that is actually displayed in the view. This may be a small portion of (0, 0, width, height) for tiling, or may be a larger area that encompasses (0, 0, width, height ) for displaying the portion of the view outside the aspect frame.
pass The current pass number for jitter operations
totalPasses The total number of passes for jitter operations
depthOfField true if depth of field should be applied.

Implemented in DzBasicCamera, DzDistantLight, and DzSpotLight.

DzError DzCamera::setLabel ( const QString &  label  )  [virtual]

Changes the camera label.

Parameters:
name The new name for the camera.
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.

Member Data Documentation

DzCamera::m_headLight [protected]

The head light for this camera. Is created with the camera as a child of the camera.

DzCamera::m_isViewCamera [protected]

true if this is a viewing camera that should not be keyed and should not participate in undo.

DzCamera::m_type [protected]

The type of this camera
